author: Matthew Dobitsch
comment: This app is causing connection issues at the system level with my New Balance RunIQ watch (running Android Wear v1). Makes the watch unresponsive to settings commands from the Android Wear app and requires a factory reset for full connectivity restoration. Went through this a couple of times before I found the culprit.

author: Piece Yen
comment: I dont understand why there's only city areas available. If you only need maps of certain area, Viewranger could be a better option and it's basically free.

author: Mal S
comment: Works great on LG Watch Sport. This has so much potential! I'd love to see a Breadcrumb trail that stays if you navigate away from the map screen. A way to record and see your trip (gpx?) would be great too. I've purchased the app, keep up the good work. Cheers

author: Chris Allen
comment: Great app, just what I was seeking. The only truly stand alone maps and navigation app for Wear. Pity there aren't more maps or an easier way to generate maps and navigation data.

author: Mike M
comment: Fail to see the point. Why not do this by entire state or allow a selected map region to be downloaded similar to Google.

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: This is because regions are too large to transfer them in reasonable time onto watch. Moreover, you can download yourself map you need, instructions can be found in app describing how to do that.

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: In trial mode the wear app is completely useless. Otherwise it also wouldn't be useful, since it doesn't have city transport navigation, neither car navigation. If this app was made for pedestrians in cities, then you should at least add city transport option. If I'm on foot, and wanna walk somewhere nearby, then why would I need a navigation app? If I'm on foot and wanna travel somewhere, then I'll need transportation options! In the current state of this app is useless and silly.

author: Danny Coultrup
comment: No way to put these maps on my huawei watch 2

author: Marius Catana
comment: This app sucks...and i paid for this.

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: Then why have you paid. You are offered free trial. If you do not like it, don't buy it.

author: Reon Fourie
comment: Amazing app the only standaline offline gps for sony smartwatch 3

author: Sysroot 1
comment: The map seems fine when it has the massive label "Trial" plastered over it. But when you pay to have that removed, all the street names get removed as well!  And the clearer street names in the OSM maps, is the only reason I wanted to use this app!!  How useless!

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: We've just uploaded updated version of the map, which should now show street names if they are provided in the map. Just zoom-in and names should show-up. Sorry for inconvenience.

title: Warning: Don't pay for the upgrade!

author: Ian Grody
comment: Just how it needs to be. Lightweight, fast, no fuddeling around. Provides a robust amount of information and places to visit. Only two suggestions, can manually added Pins please be added to maybe a subcategory for POI to be used to start and stop point (phone free navigation)? And can Pins be added from watch using current centered position please? Many thanks.
title: Simple and Sweet

author: Josef Gunawan
comment: If i have found a POI that i wanna visit, would it provide turn by turn direction to get to poi?
title: Would like to make a purchase!

author: Oliver Amparo
comment: The app is good offline maps work but the labels does not show up.
title: Philippines Map

author: Michael Stewart
comment: Map doesn't reach the Northern Beaches

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: We have just updated map of Sydney, which now includes much larger area.

title: Sydney map.doesn't cover all of Sydney

author: sheetal chauhan
comment: Excellent
title: It is avery good app.

author: kailey johnson
comment: All good

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: We encourage you to read the description first, and only then download the app and give review. Using offensive language in reviews is against Google policy.

author: Tan Dennis
comment: Singapore map not working on sony smart watch 3 , it used to be working but recently it dont show the map but just the outline of the country

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: Just checked the map and it works fine. Please, try deleting and downloading the map again and if this does not work then reinstall the map. Maybe you accidentally removed app data from your device when cleaning for more storage space? Before giving us bad note, please give us a chance to fix the things and let us know about problems via e-mail.

author: Mauricio ET
comment: Purchased IAP to remove trial text only to find out it doesn't even work. Constantly crashes when calculating route.

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: We are sorry for your problem. As written in description navigation is in testing phase. Can you generate crash report and e-mail it to us? We will try to resolve the issue. To generate crash report go to Android Wear app on your phone and from actions menu select "Report wearable bug". Without this information we cannot locate the problem.

title: Crashes

author: Mark Mitchell
comment: Works great sw3

author: PETER O'Grady
comment: Run map, comes up with trial,  went to phone and could not find any settings. How can we change or selection options. Cannot use with trial plastered all over watch face.

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: As Trial text suggests this is a trial version of the app. Options are accessible both form phone as well as from the watch. Use app to transfer map first. Then start watch app and select map you would like to see. Tap on screen and click on gear icon for options. Use phone app to buy Trial removal

title: Help

author: Richard Perry
comment: Much easier to use. It's nice to be able to quickly get your location without digging out the phone. Having offline map data on my SW3 means that I also have a fallback if something were to go wrong with my phone or data access.
title: Latest update is a great improvement.

author: Matej Drobnič
comment: Offline map is limited to selection of few cities. Although devs claim they can add requested cities in few days it doesn't really help if you are on a trip and arrive to a city that is not yet added. Without ability to download whole countries (including roads between cities) or at least broader area it is not very useful.  Also it forces you to buy premium version. I want to test free version first, but it is impossible because you can't see actual map because it is covered by huge TRIAL sign.

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: We are sorry that your city is not included, but we could not add all cities at once. However this should not be a problem. You can use app to request city map, which we will add in a few days. Moreover, app also allows to import user created map. You can create map of any city and import it into your smartwatch. Its all described in the app.

author: Kirsty Frederiksen
comment: Really like this app. It works on my Sony Smartwatch 3 when not paired to phone! So very cool to have a standalone map with GPS!   I too found it difficult occasional to close the options section. Also, how do I access the directions ability on my watch? Couldn't work it out at all! (I've downloaded the directions to my watch ok). Thanks!  EDIT: Of course, now that I ask the question I find it: hold down on a part of the map for a full second (I'd tried just tapping or tapping and hold for a moment).

author: Farot Kutarion
comment: Requested maps are added very quickly!
title: Good apps

author: Vasilis Sirianos
comment: How do I exit app's options in lg watch r??

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: Swipe from the left border towards right. However, if there are still problems, then let us know, we will try to solve this.

title: How do I exit options?!?!?

author: Michael Knyazev
comment: Would be great to have same experience with screen as with Google Maps: the screen dims, BUT when user presses screen the map appears back, i.e. no need to start the app again and again.
title: "Smart dim" screen mode needed

author: Pano 360
comment: This is what I bought my Sony Smartwatch 3 for. You can see maps even when you don't have signal. With an SW3 it'll even give you your location with no connection. This is one of the best apps I've found for the watch.
title: Works like a dream!

author: Greg Simmons
comment: Dev is superb at adding new maps.   Should allow other osmaps to be uploaded.   Or allow for 50 mile radius map of current location to be downloaded

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content:
Hi, we are sorry that you city is not covered. But you can always request map and in few days time we will add it.
We limit size of the map max to 50 MB, however in the future we want to add option for the users to define their own maps loaded onto SD card.

title: Needs more maps,  but great dev

author: Duncan Greaves
comment: Had some problems with a launcher that seems to lock up map transfers. Deleted the launcher.
title: Good

author: avinash pm
comment: (Updated) initially I was gtg trial e1 after gtg premium version. Had to clean slate and install again.. Awesome experience... (suggestion) Add more offline and interactive maps

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: Hi, we are sorry for trouble. During our tests we did not encounter this problem. Try to uninstall the app. Install it one more time. Then before starting it on the phone, wait till it installs on watch. Start the watch app, and after starting it run the phone app. The phone app should recognize that you already have premium and remove Trial text.

title: Grt

author: Mark Regan
comment: Pretty useless as a trial.

author: Mike Amy
comment: Pros: Simple, easy to use. scroll, zoom, show direction, support Sony SW3 inbuilt GPS! Tips: I paid for the premium version and downloaded a map for my city, uploaded it to the watch, but there was black text covering the map telling me "Please, use the phone app first to download and transfer maps to your wearable". To get rid of that I held down my finger until the red cross showed so I could restart the app. Then I was in a world of wrist-mounted map pleasure.
title: (Sony Smart Watch 3)

author: Robert Moraru
comment: Please add Bucharest-Romania so I can use it as well... I find it a vrey nice ideea! Thank you!                           Thank you very much for the prompt response and the update, it works perfect! As soon as I get payd, I will buy the full version altolhough you where decent enough to leave the app fully usable with the free version as well. Kudos to you! Cheers!    5 stars ;)

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: Thanks for your request. The map should be available tomorrow.

title: Nice ideea!

author: Fernando Perez
comment: Please add the map for Quito, Ecuador

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: Please find the map for Quito, Ecuador added.

author: Jonathan Tseng
comment: App has huge "trial" label slapped across it which makes it unusable unless you pay for it. This isn't disclosed at all in app description which misleads ppl into thinking this is a free app its not. Avoid.

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content:
We appreciate your comment, however naming our app Ransomeware we find unjust and offensive.
Ransomware would indicate that the app takes something hostage and demands ransom payment, which is definitely NOT the case. You can uninstall app at any moment without any adverse effects.
Yes, the app is a trial, but we do not force to make any purchases.

title: Ransomware

author: Jan Mors
comment: Very useful having offline map on watch. No wating for network for displaying map

author: Ken Weise
comment: I find it hard to rate this app. It looks like it might be good, but the trial stamp over everything makes it impossible to tell. Premium cost is typo high. Uninstalled.
title: Might be OK

author: guu guu
comment: Could you please force the app to use the watch's built-in gps when it's activated instead of the phone's gps? [Edit:] Yes the watch automatically uses the phone's gps when connected, that's what I meant. I know that's the default behavior of android wear but it's possible to force the watch to use its own gps even when connected - I've seen another app doing it. My phone's gps is disabled usually and it doesn't make much sense to pull out my phone to turn on its gps everytime before I use this app on watch

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: Hi, thanks for 5 stars. Regarding the watch GPS, the current implementation supports it already. Users of Sony watches already confirmed that. Android Wear automatically picks source of GPS. Probably, if phone is connected it uses phone to save battery and get faster fix. Have you tried to use the app without phone connected?

title: Responsive developer

author: Rich H
comment: Free download which is unusable due to a massive TRIAL word stamped across the screen, offline map download is limited, better off just sticking with Google maps.

reply.author: TPGTeam
reply.content: The app description clearly states that this is a trial. Trial message can be removed so the full functionality of the app can be used. The main goal of the app is to deliver offline maps, a service which is not offered by Google. New maps can be added by user or requested, we offer almost 600 maps.

title: Unusable

author: Ayuesh Borana
comment: For some reason when I use offline maps on my Sony smartwatch 3 it shows me a trial screen and blocks my views of the map
title: Shows trial
